Here are some examples.

  • Let be the category of -typical topological Cartier modules (see this paper), i.e., -spectra with an -equivariant factorization of the norm. The Postnikov filtration on the underlying spectrum defines a -structure on whose heart is the category of abelian groups equipped with endomorphisms and such that . The process of tensoring with amounts to sending to the generalized Eilenberg-Maclane object . Note, however, that the -action on a -typical topological Cartier module need not satisfy any compatibility with the Postnikov filtration on its underlying nonequivariant spectrum.
  • Let be a homotopy commutative ring spectrum. The -category of synthetic spectra is introduced in this paper. It is a presentable stable -category which is locally filtered via a natural -structure. There is an equivalence , and is equivalent to Hovey’s stable -category of -comodules if is Landweber exact. Under the equivalence between cellular -motivic spectra and of ``even’’ synthetic spectra, the map corresponds to the motivic map . Thanks to this example, the map should be thought of as giving a theory of weights.

Related to this observation, we note that filtered compactly generated symmetric monoidal stable -categories admit slice filtrations. Recall from Section 2 of this paper that if is a compactly generated symmetric monoidal stable -category, then a slice structure on is the data of a family

of full subcategories of such that:

  • Each is closed under equivalences;
  • is generated under colimits and extensions by a set of compact objects;
  • Each compact generator of is contained in some .

The second statement allows one to characterize in terms of : for instance, if , one can let to obtain a slice filtration. More generally: if is a filtered compactly generated symmetric monoidal stable -category, with a set of compact generators, let denote the full subcategory generated under colimits and extensions by . Then forms a slice structure on . This deserves to be called the ``effective slice filtration’’, motivated by motivic homotopy theory. In general, it is not possible to define an analogue of the very effective slice filtration.
